Hello Dav=C3=AD=C3=B0,

Those are both interesting and worthy feature ideas=
. I don't believe
either exists yet.

You might have better luck with conte=
nt digest based deduplication,
instead of if-modified-since. You'll get you=
r outlinks that way. Also,
I believe wayback has better support for that ty=
pe of deduplication.

Noah


On Thu, Mar 24, 2016 at 9:57 AM, Dav=C3=AD=C3=
=B0 Steinn Geirsson david@...
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogr=
oups.com> wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I'm just starting out running heritrix. I ha=
d some questions
> regarding the deduplication support.
>
> Are there any t=
ools to work with the dedup history database? For
> example it would be rea=
lly good to be able to create a new job,
> run a script to parse some WARC =
file(s) and fill in the BDB
> history, so I can let the new job reference p=
reviously crawled
> items. Does something like this exist already?
>
> Is t=
here any support in the current development version for
> injecting outlink=
s from previous crawls if using
> If-Modified-Since ? I'm currently on 3.2.=
0 but that feature would
> get me to run a development build.
>
> Best rega=
rds,
> Dav=C3=AD=C3=B0
